duties_responsibilities.duty: Interview patients to obtain necessary identification information and prepare required forms for treatment, billing, or record release authorization.
Contact insurance companies for information and educate patients about Advance Directives and Charity Care when necessary.
Assist various departments with projects and duties deemed by the Management staff.
Complete Medicare Secondary Payer Questionnaire when necessary and enter necessary data for payment.
Attach ID bands to patients following the two identifier rule and offer a copy of the Patient Bill Of Rights and the Addendum of the Patient Rights.
Document and distribute registration forms to various locations and enter physician orders into the computer system.
Collect and enter payments into the system, balance daily receipts, and work with departments to facilitate patient movement.
Assist patients with applying for insurance coverage through the New York State Market Place and provide Charity Care Education to eligible patients.
Demonstrate knowledge of Patient Access Emergency Management process and utilize downtime procedure in Patient Access areas.
Maintain professional and confidential telephone communication, attend departmental staff meetings, and demonstrate knowledge of yearly Performance Improvement projects.
Demonstrate team work ethic, assist coworkers, and maintain neat attire and positive attitude.
